Dgame.System.Mouse



abstract class Mouse;
Represent the Mouse

Author:
Randy Schuett

enum Button: ubyte;
Supported mouse buttons

Left


Middle


Right


X1


X2


Other


enum State: ubyte;
Supported mouse states

Released


Pressed


enum MotionStates: ubyte;
Supported mouse motion states

LMask


MMask


RMask


X1Mask


X2Mask


static nothrow @nogc uint getState(int* x = null, int* y = null);
Returns the mouse state and (if y and y aren't null) the current position.

See:
Mouse.State enum

static nothrow @nogc uint getRelativeState(int* x = null, int* y = null);
Returns the relative mouse state and (if y and y aren't null) the relative position. This means the difference of the positions since the last call of this method.

See:
Mouse.RelativeState enum

static nothrow @nogc bool hasState(Button btn);
Returns if the given button is pressed.

See:
Mouse.Button

static nothrow @nogc bool hasRelativeState(Button btn);


static nothrow @nogc int[2] getCursorPosition();
Returns the cursor position as static array.

static nothrow @nogc void showCursor(bool enable);
Enable or disable that the cursor is shown on the window.

static nothrow @nogc void setCursorPosition(int x, int y);
Set the cursor position inside the window.

alias warp = setCursorPosition;
Alias for setting cursor position

static nothrow @nogc bool hasRelativeMouse();
Returns if the Relative mouse mode is enabled/supported.

static nothrow @nogc bool enableRelativeMouse(bool enable);
Tries to enable/disable the relative mouse mode.
